docs.lead_paragraph: A Dublin court found two former executives of the collapsed Anglo Irish Bank guilty on Thursday of illegal lending and providing unlawful assistance to investors during the "Celtic Tiger" boom of the past decade.

headline.main: Irish Court Convicts Two Anglo Irish Bankers of Illegal Lending
headline.print_headline: Irish Court Convicts Two Anglo Irish Bankers of Illegal Lending

docs.snippet: A Dublin court found two former executives of the collapsed Anglo Irish Bank guilty on Thursday of illegal lending and providing unlawful assistance to investors during the "Celtic Tiger" boom of the past decade.

headline.main: Bain Capital Raises $7.3 Billion for Buyout Fund

docs.abstract: The fund, which will focus on investments in North America, attracted $6.5 billion from outside investors, exceeding its target of $6 billion, a person briefed on the matter said.
docs.snippet: The fund, which will focus on investments in North America, attracted $6.5 billion from outside investors, exceeding its target of $6 billion, a person briefed on the matter said.

docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth Group Inc, the largest U.S. health insurer, said on Thursday that first-quarter profit fell due to costs and taxes related to the national healthcare reform law as well as government cuts to private Medicare funding.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Says First-Quarter Profit Fell on Reform Costs
headline.print_headline: UnitedHealth Says First-Quarter Profit Fell on Reform Costs

docs.snippet: UnitedHealth Group Inc, the largest U.S. health insurer, said on Thursday that first-quarter profit fell due to costs and taxes related to the national healthcare reform law as well as government cuts to private Medicare funding.

docs.lead_paragraph: The homemade bombs that ripped through the crowd at the finish line of last year's Boston Marathon, killing three people and injuring 264, showcased the city's medical talent but also taught valuable lessons in responding to a mass disaster.

headline.main: A Year After Marathon Bombs, Boston Hospitals Apply Lessons Learned
headline.print_headline: A Year After Marathon Bombs, Boston Hospitals Apply Lessons Learned

docs.snippet: The homemade bombs that ripped through the crowd at the finish line of last year's Boston Marathon, killing three people and injuring 264, showcased the city's medical talent but also taught valuable lessons in responding to a mass disaster.

headline.main: The Problem With Giving Employees a Stipend to Buy Health Insurance

docs.abstract: If an employer pays each worker the same amount of money to cover health insurance premiums, older employees will have to pay a larger share of their premiums than their younger colleagues. Is that legal?
docs.snippet: If an employer pays each worker the same amount of money to cover health insurance premiums, older employees will have to pay a larger share of their premiums than their younger colleagues. Is that legal?

docs.abstract: A growing number of young adults are taking psychiatric medicines for longer and longer periods, at the very age when they are also consolidating their identities, making plans for the future and navigating adult relationships.
docs.snippet: A growing number of young adults are taking psychiatric medicines for longer and longer periods, at the very age when they are also consolidating their identities, making plans for the future and navigating adult relationships.

docs.lead_paragraph: A day after Detroit scaled back the large pension benefit cuts it had proposed, the bankrupt city fended off charges that it had caved in to retirees in ways that could come back to haunt it.

headline.main: Pensioners in Detroit Rejoice, Though Deal Is Far From Done
headline.print_headline: Pensioners in Detroit Rejoice, Though Deal Is Far From Done

docs.abstract: Detroit's pensioners rejoice day after city scales back from large pension benefit cuts it had once been proposing; city fends off charges from critics that it simply caved into retirees in ways that could come back to haunt it, but it also shares elation of many current and former employees who for months had feared a more dire outcome.
docs.snippet: A day after Detroit scaled back the large pension benefit cuts it had proposed, the bankrupt city fended off charges that it had caved in to retirees in ways that could come back to haunt it.

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino reported from Detroit, and Monica Davey from Chicago.
byline.original: By STEVEN YACCINO and MONICA DAVEY

docs.lead_paragraph: The Jets signed running back Chris Johnson, adding speed to their backfield, and the Giants picked up Josh Freeman to back up Eli Manning at quarterback.

headline.main: Jets Add Spark While Giants Get Insurance
headline.print_headline: Jets Add Backfield Spark; Giants Get Insurance

docs.abstract: New York Jets sign running back Chris Johnson, adding speed to their backfield, and New York Giants pick up Josh Freeman to back up Eli Manning at quarterback.
docs.snippet: The Jets signed running back Chris Johnson, adding speed to their backfield, and the Giants picked up Josh Freeman to back up Eli Manning at quarterback.

headline.main: The Birth of a Conspiracy Theory

docs.abstract: Some on the right speculate that the Obama administration is trying to politicize the census.

docs.lead_paragraph: The outlook for the president's health care overhaul suddenly appears brighter, and some Democrats are saying it's time for the party to openly embrace the law that Republicans consider their best campaign weapon.
